Book of Hours (Medieval text, Modern illuminations)

availability.p: Licensed for use under Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported Access Rights, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/legalcode. It is requested that copies of any published articles based on the information in this data set be sent to the curator of manuscripts, The Walters Art Museum, 600 North Charles Street, Baltimore MD 21201.

notesStmt.note: Originating in Ghent or Bruges, Flanders, in the early sixteenth century, this Dominican Book of Hours focuses on the Passion of Christ and the Corpus Christi. This book masquerades as a purely authentic medieval manuscript, when in fact it is a modern and medieval hybrid. The majority of the manuscript was made ca. 1500, but it had remained unfinished. Its nineteenth-century owner, John Boykett Jarman, commissioned English illustrator William Caleb Wing to "finish" the manuscript ca. 1850. Known for his manuscript illumination skills, Wing recreated imagery typical of a fifteenth- to sixteenth-century Flemish Book of Hours. Henry Walters was aware that the manuscript was partially painted in the nineteenth century when he purchased it, as the manuscript is noted as a "forgery" in the James C. Anderson inventory, December 7th, 1913. Whether pages and images are original or nineteenth century has been indicated both within the individual text parts as well as within the image cataloging.

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Latin.

msItem.title: Book of Hours (Medieval text, Modern illuminations)
Liturgy of Easter
msItem.rubric: Protestatio aut oratio in introitu et surrectione lectio : a quo libet xpiano dicenda : facta per sanctum vincentium ferrarii : Et primo te ipsum signa sic dicendo
msItem.incipit: In nomine patris et filii et spiritus sancti Amen
msItem.note: Dominican use; fols. 8r-11v: St. Vincent Ferrer profession prayer, oratio pro gratiarum actione, Intemerata; fols. 12r-19v: processional, St. Bernard’s verses (O Bone Jesu), instruction for the priest before the altar, Offertory, Consecration, elevation of the Host; fol. 20r-v: Pope Benedict’s prayer for indulgence; fols. 20v-21v: prayer of St. Thomas Aquinas for the elevation of the Host, adoration of the blood of Christ
Fol. 7: modern parchment; fols. 8r-v: modern parchment and text; fols. 9r-21v: original parchment and text;

msItem.title: Prayers of Pope Boniface VI and writings of St. Thomas Aquinas
msItem.rubric: Sequens oratio est scripta in tabula sancti sepulcri: et ad supplicationem philippi regis francie: bonefacius papa: vi: dedit omnibus eam devote dicentibus inter elevationem corporis xpi et agnus dei duo milia annorum de indulgentia: s
msItem.note: Fols. 23r-24v: Pope Boniface's prayers to recite for indulgence at the elevation of the Host; fols. 24v-30v: St. Thomas Aquinas' writings on the Eucharist

Fol. 22: modern parchment; fols. 23r-30v: original parchment and original text; "Papa Boniface VI" is most likely Pope Boniface XI, 1350-1404, as his successor Pope Innocent is mentioned later in the manuscript, and St. Vincent Ferrer, also explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the manuscript, was his contemporary

msItem.title: Hours of the Passion
msItem.rubric: Officium de passione domini nostri ihu xpi: ad matutina:
msItem.note: Fol. 32r: Matins; fol. 38r: Lauds; fol. 43r: Prime; fol. 47r: Terce; fol. 52r: Sext; fol. 57r: None; fol. 63r: Vespers; fol. 68r: Compline;

Fol. 31: modern parchment; fols. 32r-36v: original parchment and text; fol. 37: original parchment and original text (recto only); fols. 38r-41v: original parchment and original text; fol. 42: original parchment and original text (recto only); fols. 43r-45v: original parchment and original text; fol. 46: original parchment and original text (recto only); fols. 47-50: original parchment and original text; fols. 51: original parchment and original text (recto only); fols. 52r-55v: original parchment and original text; fol. 56: original parchment and original text (recto only): fols. 57r-61v: original parchment and original text; fol. 62: original parchment and original text (recto only); fols 63r-66v: original parchment and original text; fol. 67: modern parchment; fols. 68r-71v: original parchment and original text

msItem.title: Mass of the Five Wounds
msItem.note: Original parchment and text; fol. 72r-v: preparation of the Mass; fols. 72v-73r: stations of the cross prayer; fols. 74v-75v: Nicaenum Crede; fols. 75v-76r: Sanctus and Communion

msItem.title: The Passion of Christ, according to John
msItem.rubric: Passio domini nostri ihesu: xpristi: secundum iohannem
msItem.note: Fol. 78: modern parchment; fols. 79r-86v: original parchment and text

msItem.title: Fifteen Prayers of St. Bridget
msItem.rubric: Innocencius papa concessit omnibus vere contritis: confessis: et debite satisfactis: sequentem orationem ob honore vulneris: dextere lateris christi devote dicentibus: iiii: milia annos indulgencie: Cuius vera mensura in sequenti forma continetur
msItem.note: Fol. 88r: Pope Innocent's prayer for indulgence; fols. 89r-94r: fifteen prayers or "O's" of St. Bridget; fol. 94v: Bede's prayer, majority of prayer scratched out; fols. 94v-96v: prayers
Fol. 87: modern parchment; fols. 88r-96v: original parchment and text

msItem.title: Office of all Saints
msItem.rubric: Incipit officium de omnibus sanctis die mercurii dicendum
msItem.note: Fols. 98r-102v: Hours Prime to Compline; fols. 102v-104v: St. John's vision of the Apocalypse; fols. 104v-105r: Offertory
Fol. 97: modern parchment; fols. 98r-105v: original parchment and original text

msItem.title: Office of the Body of Christ
msItem.rubric: Incipit officium corporis xpi die iovis dicendum: ad matutina
msItem.note: Fol. 106: modern parchment; fols. 107r-111v: original parchment and original text

msItem.title: Mass of the Body of Christ
msItem.note: Fols. 113r-114r: Letter of Paul to the Corinthians; fol. 114r-114v: reading from the Gospel of John; fols. 114v-117v: Offertory and reading after Communion
Fol. 112: modern parchment; fols. 113r-117v: original parchment and original text

msItem.title: Hours of the Virgin, Saturday
msItem.rubric: Pro die sabbati hore beate marie virginis. Ad matutinas. Ymnus.
msItem.note: Fols. 119r-123v: Hours of the Virgin from Matins to Compline
Fol. 118: modern parchment: fols. 119r-123v: original parchment and text

msItem.title: Mass of the Virgin
msItem.note: Fol. 125r: the Introit; fol. 126r-v: excerpt from the libri sapentie; fols. 126v-127v: reading from the Gospel of Luke and articles; fols. 127v-128v: Offertory and Communion
Fol. 124: modern parchment: fols. 125r-128v: original parchment and text (recto only)

support.p: Thin, well-prepared parchment; thicker parchment for inserted full-page miniatures

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in pencil, top right corners, rectos; two sets of foliation (with exception of the calendar); the lower number set used here

p.formula: Collation for this manuscript cannot be completed at this time
p.catchwords: Present on bottom right of fols. 105v and 115v

layoutDesc.layout: Red ink ruling for calender and text; layout does not apply to calender (written surface 6 cm x 8.5 cm, 17 ruled lines)

handDesc.handNote: Gothic script; same scribe for entire text, with exceptions: calendar and folios opposite full-page miniatures written in 19th-century hand

decoDesc.decoNote: Modern parchment, with both text and illuminations created by W.C Wing; zodiac symbols and labors for each month represented by border illuminations
Fol. 7v: full-page miniature; fol. 8r: initial "D" (6 lines); smaller initials throughout (1-3 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 7v: modern miniature; fol. 8r: modern border
Fol. 22v: full-page miniature; small initials throughout (1-2 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 22v: modern border and miniature; fol. 23r: original/modern border, original paint mostly retouched

Eight full-page miniatures with decorative borders; eight inhabited initials (5-6 lines); secondary decorative initials throughout (1-2 lines); fol. 31v: modern border and miniature; fol. 32r: original/modern border, many losses in original paint; fol. 37v: modern border and miniature; fol. 38r: original border; fol. 42v: modern border and miniature; fol. 43r: original border; fol. 46v: modern border and miniature; fol. 47r: original border; fol. 51v: modern border and miniature; fol. 52r: original border; fol. 56v: modern border and miniature; fol. 57r: original border; fol. 62v: modern border and miniature; fol. 63r: original border; fol. 67v: modern border and miniature; fol. 68r: original border; fol. 71v: modern miniature and border
Fol. 71v: full-page miniature; fol. 72r: initial "H" (6 lines); smaller initials throughout (1-2 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 72r: modern (possibly original) border
Fol. 78v: full-page miniature; fol. 79r: initial "E" (6 lines); fol. 78v: modern border and miniature; fol. 79r: original border
Fol. 87v: full-page miniature; secondary illuminated initials throughout (2-3 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 87v: modern border and miniature; fol. 88r: original border
Fol. 97v: full-page miniature; fol. 98r: initial "D" (6 lines); smaller initials throughout (1-4 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 97v: modern miniature; fol. 98r: original border

Fol. 106v: full-page miniature; fol. 107r: "D" initial; smaller initials throughout (1-3 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 106v: modern border and miniature; fol. 107r: original/modern border, original paint in poor condition, only losses retouched

Fol. 112v: full-page miniature; fol. 113r: initial "O" (4 lines); smaller initials throughout (1-2 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 112v: modern border and miniature; fol. 113r: original/modern border, original paint in good condition

Fol. 118v: full-page miniature; fol. 119r: initial "D" (7 lines); smaller initials throughout (1-3 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 118v: modern border and miniature; fol. 119r: original/modern border, original paint in good condition with small cracks and losses
Fol. 124v: full-page miniature; fol. 125r: initial "D" (5 lines); smaller initials throughout (1-2 lines); line fillers throughout; fol. 124v: modern border and miniature; fol. 125r: original border

Illustrated calendar, twelve pages; seventeen full-page miniatures; one other miniature; illuminated borders; decorated illuminated initials in gold with alternating blue, green, and red backgrounds (5-6 lines); secondary decorated initials and line fillers contain silver or gold letters and alternating blue and red backgrounds (2-3 lines); text in varying light-dark black ink

decoNote.title: Philip of France before Pope Boniface
decoNote.note: Pope Boniface VI's prayers for indulgence

note.p: Modern addition; parchment distorted in upper half
Modern addition; red ruling under modern paint, verso; parchment distorted
Modern addition; red ruling under modern paint, verso; parchment distorted
Modern addition; red ruling under modern paint, verso; parchment distorted; bounding lines in metal point in bottom margin, recto
Modern addition; red ruling under modern paint, verso; parchment distorted

decoNote.title: Presentation of Christ in the temple

note.p: Modern addition; red ruling under modern paint, verso; parchment very distorted; some bleed through motif not seen elsewhere; no retouching
Modern addition; red ruling in modern paint, verso; parchment very distorted
Modern addition; red ruling under modern paint, verso; parchment very distorted

decoNote.title: Christ in the Garden of Gethsemane
Christ in Gethsemane upheld by angel

binding.p: Nineteenth-century purple velvet binding by Léon Gruel (his bookplate number 1397); nineteenth-century metal clasp with allegorical figures

history.provenance: Made in the early sixteenth century in Bruges or Ghent, Flanders
John Boykett Jarman commissioned W.C Wing to add illuminations, London, ca. 1850
Jarman sold manuscript at Sotheby's auction on June 13-14, 1864, lot 93
Léon Gruel, Paris, before 1913; Gruel and Engelmann bookplate with inscription "1397"
Henry Walters, Baltimore, purchased from Gruel in 1913
history.acquisition: Walters Art Museum, 1931, by Henry Walters' bequest

listBibl.head: Relevant Works
listBibl.bibl: De Ricci, Seymour, and W. J. Wilson. Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada. Vol. 1. New York: H. W. Wilson Company, 1935; p. 808, cat. no. 319.
Backhouse, Janet. A Victorian Connoisseur and His Manuscripts: The Tale of Mr. Jarman and Mr. Wing. British Museum Quarterly 32, nos. 3-4 (1968): 76-92.
Bowles, Edmund A. "A Checklist of Musical Instruments in Fifteenth Century Illuminated Manuscripts at the Walters Art Gallery." Quarterly of the Music Library Association 32 (1976): 719-726; 720.

Randall, Lilian M. C. Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the Walters Art Gallery. Vol. 3, Belgium, 1250-1530. Baltimore and London: Johns Hopkins University Press in association with the Walters Art Gallery, 1997; p. 629, cat. no. App. I.
